tuv.seg: The Abbey Theatre in Dublin city is Ireland’s national theatre, founded by by W.B
Is í Amharclann na Mainistreach i mBaile Átha Cliath amharclann náisiúnta na hÉireann, a bhunaigh W.B
Yeats and Lady Gregory in 1903
Yeats agus Lady Gregory i 1903
It has contributed some of the world’s greatest theatrical works from writers such as J M Synge and Sean O’Casey
Chabhraigh sí le roinnt de na saothair amharclainne is fearr ar domhan a thaibhiú ó scríbhneoirí, fearacht J M Synge agus Seán O’Casey
It continues to nurture new writing as well as presenting Irish and international classic drama
Leanann sí le scríbhneoireacht nua a chothú, chomh maith le drámaíocht chlasaiceach Éireannach agus idirnáisiúnta a chur i láthair
A calendar of events is available on the Theatre’s website
Tá fáil ar fhéilire imeachtaí ar láithreán gréasáin na hAmharclainne
The Abbey Theatre has 2 auditoriums, the Abbey stage and the Peacock stage
Tá dhá halla ann in Amharclann na Mainistreach, stáitse na Mainistreach agus stáitse Peacock
The seating capacity for the Abbey is 492, while the Peacock has capacity for 128
Is é an líon suíochán atá i stáitse na Mainistreach 492, agus is é an líon suíochán do stáitse Peacock 128
Information on accessibility is available here
Tá fáil ar fhaisnéis faoi inrochtaineacht anseo
The Theatre has a programme of workshops, talks and events for people of all ages
Tá ag an Amharclann clár ceardlann, cainteanna agus imeachtaí do dhaoine de gach aois
It also provides backstage tours and produces resource packs
Ina theannta sin, cuireann sí turais chúl an stáitse ar fáil mar aon le pacáistí acmhainní a chur i dtoll a chéile
Find more information on the Theatre’s education programme here
Is féidir teacht ar thuilleadh faisnéise faoi chlár oideachais na hAmharclainne anseo
